intro: Clompanus mastersii, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Clompanus mastersii is often found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies.
